sentences.en: Despite his hectic work schedule, Benny has rarely suffered poor health.
sentences.cn: 尽管工作繁忙，本尼却少有身体不好的时候。

sentences.en: He has swapped his hectic rock star's lifestyle for that of a country gentleman.
sentences.cn: 他一改摇滚歌星紧张忙碌的生活方式，开始过起了乡村绅士的生活。

sentences.en: I have a hectic schedule for the next few days.
sentences.cn: 我今后几天的日程紧得要命。

sentences.en: I’ve had a pretty hectic day.
It seems to ease all the aches and pains of a hectic and tiring day.
sentences.cn: 繁忙劳碌了一天所带来的周身酸痛似乎被一扫而空。

sentences.en: It was a hectic disorganized weekend.
sentences.cn: 这个周末忙乱得一塌糊涂。

sentences.en: It was hectic at work today; I had so many phone calls and queries to answer that I didn't know whether I was on my head or my heels.
sentences.cn: 今天的工作真紧张, 我要接的电话和要回答的问题太多了,我真不知所措.

sentences.en: It's a bit hectic. I'm in the middle of cooking for nine people.
sentences.cn: 我正忙着为9个人做饭呢，有点儿忙不过来。

sentences.en: My life was very hectic but empty before I met him.
sentences.cn: 在遇到他之前，我的生活非常繁忙却很空虚。

sentences.en: the hectic flush on her cheeks
The last few weeks have been hectic.
sentences.cn: 过去几周一直忙得不可开交。

sentences.en: The two days we spent there were enjoyable but hectic.
sentences.cn: 我们在那里度过的两天愉快但忙乱。

sentences.en: We both have such hectic schedules.
sentences.cn: 我们俩日程安排得都很紧。

sentences.en: You have had a hectic [ tiring ] day.
sentences.cn: 你们 辛苦 了一整天.

trans.tran_cn: 繁忙的，忙乱的，兴奋的，狂热的，（因患肺病等）发烧的，患热病的
trans.tran_en: if your face is a hectic colour, it is very pink
